gurmukhi: XwhI qy dYq sMGwrn nwm ikDo qumro sB hI jug geIAw ] qau hm pwie prI qumro jbhI qum qY ieh pY br peIXw ]284]
transliteration: Yaahidait Sanhaaran Naam Kidho Toumro Sabh Hijoug Gadeaa|| Tau Ham Paae Paritoumre Jab-hitoum Tai Eh Pai Bar Paeeaa||284||
translation: Therefore, O mother ! Thy name is sung all over the world as the destroyer of demons; we shall fall at thy feet again, when this boon will be bestowed upon us.”284.

gurmukhi: dYqn kI miRq swD syvk kI brqw qUM khY kib sXwm Awid AMqhUM kI krqw ] dIjY brdwn moih krq ibnMqI qoih kwnH kr dIjY doK dwrd kI hrqw ]
transliteration: Daitan Kimrit Saadh Sewak Kibartaa Toon Kahai Kabi Syaam Aadh Ant-hoon Kikartaa|| Deejai Bardaan Mohe Karat Binantitohe Kaahn Kar Deejai Kokh Daarad Kihartaa||
translation: The poet Shyam says, “O goddess ! Thou art the death of the demons and lover of the saints and the creator of the beginning and the end;

gurmukhi: qUMhI pwrbqI AStBUjI quhI dyvI quhI quhI rUp Cupw quhI pythU kI Brqw ] quhI lwl quhI syq rUp pIq quhI quhI rUp Drw ko hY quhI Awp krqw ]285]
transliteration: Toon-hipaarbatiashtbhujituhidevituhituhiroop Chhudhaa Tuhipet-hoo Kibhartaa|| Tuhiroop Laal Tuhiset Roop Peet Tuhituhiroop Dharaa Ko Hai Tuhiaap Kartaa||285||
translation: “Thou art Parvati, the eight-armed goddess, extremely beautiful and the sustainer of the hungry; Thou art the red, white and yellow colour and Thou art the manifestation and creator of the earth.”285

gurmukhi: bwhin isMG Bujw ASt ijh ckR qiRSUl gdw kr mY ] brCI sr Fwl kmwn inKMg Dry kt jo br hY br mY ]
transliteration: Baahan(i) Singh Bhujaa Asht Jih Chakra Trishool Gadaa Kar Mai|| Barchhisar Dhaal Kamaan Nikhanndddare Kat Jo Bar Hai Bar Mai||
translation: “The lion is Thy vehicle; O eight-armed goddess ! The disc, the trident and the mace are in you hands; there are dagger, arrows shield, bow also and the quiver in the waist;

gurmukhi: gupIAw sB syv krY iqh kI icq dYq hmY iqh kY hir mY ] pun A`Cq DUD pMcwNmiRq dIp jgwvq hwr frY gr mY ]286]
transliteration: Goupeeaa Sabh Sev Darai Tih Kichit Dait Hamai Tih Kai Har(i) Mai|| Poun Achhat Dhoop Panchaanmrit Deep Jagadvat Haar Darai Gad Mai||286||
translation: “All the gopis are worshipping the goddess, with desire for Krishna in their minds; they are offering fragrance, incense and Panchamrit and lighting the earthen lamps, they are putting the garlands of flowers around her neck.286

gurmukhi: qohI ko sunY hY jwp qyro hI jpY hY iDAwn qyro hI DrY hY n jpY hY kwhUM Awn kO ] qyro gun gYhY hm qyry hI khY hY PUl qohI pY frY hY sB rwKY qyry mwn kO
transliteration: Tohiko Sounai Hai Jaap Tero Hijapai Hai Dhiaan Tero Hiddarai Hai Na Japai Hai Kaahoon Aan Kau|| Tero Goun Gadhai Ham Dere Hikahai Hai Phool Tohipai Darai Hai Sabh Raakhai Dere Maan Kau||
translation: “O mother ! we are causing Thee to listen, we are repeating Thy Name, and we are not remembering anyone else; we are singing Thy praises and we are offering flowers to honour Thee;

gurmukhi: jYsy br dIno hmY hoiekY pRsMin pwCY qYsy br dIjY hmY kwnH sur gXwn kO ] dIjIAY ibBUq kY bnwspqI dIjY kYDo mwlw dIjY moiqn kY muMdRw dIjY kwn kO ]287]
transliteration: Jaise Bar Deeno Hamai Hoe-kai Prasann(i) Paachhai Taise Bar Deejai Hamai Kaahn Sur Gyaan Kau|| Deejeeai Bibhoot Kai Banaaspatideejai Kaidho Maalaa Deejai Motin Kai Mounndraa Deejai Kaan Kau||287||
translation: The type of boon bestowed by Thee earlier on us, likewise bestow another boon regarding Krishna; if Krishna cannot be given to us, then give us ashes (for smearing our body), a Kanthi (necklace) to be put around our neck and rings for our ear so that we m

gurmukhi: qO hs bwq khI durgw hm qo qumko hir ko bru dYhY ] hohu pRsMin sBY mn mY qum s`q khXO nhI JUT khY hY ]
transliteration: Tau Has Baat Kahidurgad Ham To Toumko Har(i) Ko Bar(u) Daihai|| Hoh(u) Prasann(i) Sabhai Man Mai Toum Satt Kahyau Nahijhooth Kahai Hai||
translation: Then Durga said smilingly, “I have bestowed the boon of Krishna on all of you; all of you may remain pleased, because I have spoken the truth and not told a lie;

gurmukhi: kwnih ko suK ho qumko hm so suK so AKIAw Bir lYhY ] jwhu khXo sB hI qum fyrn kwnH vhY br ko qum pY hY ]288]
transliteration: Kaanah(i) Ko Soukh Ho Toumko Ham So Soukh So Akheeaa Bhar(i) Laihai|| Jaahu Kahyo Sabh Hitoum Deran Kaahn Vahai Bar Ko Toum Pai Hi||288||
translation: “Krishna will be a comfort for you and seeing you n comfort, my eyes shall be filled with comfort; you may all go to your homes and Krishna will wed all of you.”288.
